CTimeDate Class Reference

CTimeDate Timer functionality and time and date functions, last updated 10/29/2001. More...

#include <time/time_date.h>

List of all members.

Public Methods

  • CTimeDate ()
    default constructor

  • ~CTimeDate ()
    default destructor

  • bool GetTime (std::string &str)
    Returns the actual time in the parameter "Time" in the format: HH:MM:SS.

  • bool GetDate (std::string &str)
    Returns the actual date in the parameter "Date" in the format: Weekday Month Day.

  • bool StartTimer ()
    Starts the timer If timer already started, nothing is done.

  • double StopTimer ()
    Stops the timer.

  • bool TimerHold ()
    Sometimes it may be usefull to hold the timer (for example if the program waits for user input) without receiving a result.

  • bool TimerContinue ()
    Makes the timer run again after a call to StopTimer().

  • double GetTimer ()
    Returns the timer value but don't stop it!

  • void SecondsToHMS (unsigned long Seconds, std::string &str)
    Converts seconds to the H--H:MM:SS format as in GetTime(), but with arbitrary number of ciffers to represent the hours.

  • std::string SecondsToHMS (unsigned long Seconds)
    Same as method SecondsToHMS(unsigned long Seconds, string& str), except the result is returned directly as a string.

Static Public Methods

  • bool GetDateTimeYear (std::string &DTY)
    Returns the full date, time and year in the parameter "DTY" in the format: Weekday Month Day HH:MM:SS Year.

  • std::string GetDateTimeYear ()
    Same as GetDateTimeYear(std::string& DTY), except the result is returned directly as a string.

Detailed Description

CTimeDate Timer functionality and time and date functions, last updated 10/29/2001.

Get actual time and date (24 hours). Use the timer to calculate precise time elapsed (down to 1/100 seconds)

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.98, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Member Function Documentation

bool CTimeDate::GetDate (  std::string &    str ) 
 

Returns the actual date in the parameter "Date" in the format: Weekday Month Day.

Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Returns :
false if failed, otherwise true

Definition at line 61 of file time_date.cpp.

std::string CTimeDate::GetDateTimeYear (    )  [static]
 

Same as GetDateTimeYear(std::string& DTY), except the result is returned directly as a string.

If it fails, the return value is "CTimeDate::GetDateTimeYear() ERROR ".

Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Returns :
false if failed, otherwise true

Definition at line 174 of file time_date.cpp.

std::string CTimeDate::SecondsToHMS (  unsigned long    Seconds ) 
 

Same as method SecondsToHMS(unsigned long Seconds, string& str), except the result is returned directly as a string.

A bit slower but can be convenient.

Parameters:
Seconds  The value to be converted
Returns :
string containing the time as H--H:MM:SS

Definition at line 204 of file time_date.cpp.

void CTimeDate::SecondsToHMS (  unsigned long    Seconds,
std::string &    str
) 
 

Converts seconds to the H--H:MM:SS format as in GetTime(), but with arbitrary number of ciffers to represent the hours.

Result placed in "str".

Parameters:
Seconds  The value to be converted
str  Result is placed in here

Definition at line 196 of file time_date.cpp.

bool CTimeDate::StartTimer (    ) 
 

Starts the timer If timer already started, nothing is done.

Returns :
false if the timer was already started

Definition at line 106 of file time_date.cpp.

double CTimeDate::StopTimer (    ) 
 

Stops the timer.

Only possible if the timer is started with a call to StartTimer(). Otherwise does nothing.

Returns :
Timer value in seconds, -1 if timer was not started

Definition at line 123 of file time_date.cpp.

bool CTimeDate::TimerContinue (    ) 
 

Makes the timer run again after a call to StopTimer().

Parameters:
false  if timer was not on hold, then doing nothing

Definition at line 157 of file time_date.cpp.

bool CTimeDate::TimerHold (    ) 
 

Sometimes it may be usefull to hold the timer (for example if the program waits for user input) without receiving a result.

Release it again with a call to TimerContinue()

Returns :
false if timer was already on hold, then doing nothing
